Tiger Woods is available at 40/1 to win the 2022 US Masters with BetfairCredit: GETTY
BETFAIR - GET £100 IN FREE BETS*
Five-time champion Woods announced plans to make his long-awaited return to action at Augusta this week.
"Over the past 10 years, the average winner has had pre-tournament odds at 40/1 on Betfair, and having confirmed that he will play, punters have backed the Golf legend into, you guessed it, 40/1.
"According to the research, Brits Matthew Fitzpatrick, Paul Casey and Tyrrell Hatton also have a good chance of putting on the Green Jacket with odds of 40/1 to win the tournament.
But if he does tee off on Thursday - Betfair think he's got a great chance of landing a SIXTH Green Jacket, which would see him equal Jack Nicklaus' record.
"It will be one of the greatest comeback stories in sport if Tiger, who is playing for the first time since his serious car crash 13 months ago, wins.
11 other golfers share odds of 40/1, including Matthew Fitzpatrick, Paul Casey, Tyrrell Hatton, Bryson DeChambeau and Hideki Matsuyama.
That's according to statistical analysis of pre-tournament prices over the past 10 years, provided by bookmakers Betfair.
"Going into tomorrow's opening day, Jon Rahm and Justin Thomas can’t be separated, and are joint favourites at 11/1."
Betfair have concluded that the average winner of the US Masters has had odds of 40/1 before the competition started.
Woods hasn't featured in a high-level event since a car crash left him with life-threatening injuries.
The 46-year-old will play nine holes today before confirming the decision.
